review_blob: Relly nicey done. It was a brett wild ipa that was tasty. Not too funky, balanced and tame for spont ferm beer. Had a light rustic barnyard flavor but in an ipa that tastes great. Light head and aroma was slight and mostly alco ester with caramel bread dough. Overall pretty dang good.

Ok, not a huge pils guy but with mikkeller he always amazes you with his ability to know what "you" like and does it different and usually better. Light citrus and hints of apricot aroma. Crisp and clean. Good light smooth mouthfeel. Taste is hints of caramel, but all flavor of a hoppy brew that doesnt go too far. A lil hop spice in the swallow but doesnt linger and makes you keep coming back. I could drink this all day. Overall well balanced and the hop makes it interesting.

Super soft, silky smooth pillowy mouthfeel and great drinkabilitly. The head is light and falls quickly (draft) but good legs. Aroma is citrusy, nelson grapey and hint of bubblegum. Not crazy hoppy, didnt see the IBU but I would say 50-60 but so well balanced Id prolly be surprised. I think it was 6.5 abv. Taste is awesome and the palate is saturated with hops, uber nice drinkability which I expect nothing less from Mikkel. As always he never lets me down. This guy is my favorite brewer, he has the midas touch. And it reminds you of that when you take a bottle home.
Right in the middle of the pack for a blonde. Not bad, true to style. CLean and refreshing but just another "we gotta make a blonde" type beer nothing outrageous but good nonetheless
Same as buffalo butt. too much carmel malt and rye. Grainy and lots of cereal. Red color, thin head. Just ok
beer_name: Big Texan Texas Red Amber Ale

review_blob: Not my fav but not bad. Its a red amber color with thin off wehite head. Its got too much caramel grain and some rye I think. Its a lil too much and reds are slipping as one of my favorite style due to use of too much of these bits in most offerings out there. Its tasty but I couldnt drink more than 2 or 3

Ok, so I love saison, but this one kinda missed the mark for me. It is true to style and color and spice. I just think it couldve had less spice and more barnyard true funk. Its clean but unfiltered and pale yellow color. Hops are in the background, spice and doughy banana leather up front. OVerall real nice but not my fav for the style.

Pretty good. An APA brewd with English ingredients and style. Nice malty backbone with hops finish to balance it out. Alcohol, dough and grassy citrus hops round out the swallow. Foam is nice and heady but falls quickly leaving nice legs. Brownish amber color. Overall real nice and isnt the normal English IPA that is a little weaker, you wont expect that tastes like the IPA you wanted to have.

Good stuff. Well crafted and malty. Hops backup this nice hefty brew. Good full mouthfeel with doughy, malty goodness. It reminds of a nice belgian brown made with american yeast and without the spices. Good brew overall nothing too overpowering but has some alco in the sip but balanced.

Nice and different. It was designed with cereal in mind to create a unique beer. Pretty good taste of grain and light refreshing taste and mouthfeel. Gets a lil sweet and kinda changes on the tongue. Overall well made and different than normal.

I really liked it. Dont know the IBUs but its plenty to make me want to drink a few. Its nose is citrus floral hop. Aftertaste on palate lingers with hop resins but not crazy. Appearance is dark amber color with foamy head. Had on tap, tasty brew, overall really nice offering.

Pretty nice. Not alot of hops, but tasty and sessionable. Thin foam head on top that turns into nice legs after some sipping. Good hop aroma, spicy bread and floral hits the nose and tongue. Aftertaste doesnt linger too long and its all pretty well balanced. Good PA for noobs or those who say they dont like hoppy beers.

This is a good brew for an american light beer. Clean, refreshing and smooth. No funk or lingering aftertaste. It actually does seem that the water is higher quality than typical light beers. It may be all in my head and its made in the back of the bud factory, but it is my new go to cheapo brew. Golden amber in color, a little head and lacing, not too carbonated. Just go get some, you will enjoy it. Get the Orange box!

Not bad. I see what they did with this one. They upped the abv and went easy on a tame saison yeast strain to make it doable for everyone. My only gripe is in this case I like the funky, eartht, lick a rusty barn funkiness to belgo/french saisons. Taste and aroma are clean and nice, The palate is smooth and easy going. Not much funk but they make their point. Overall not too shabby, A really good offering for newcomers to the funky brew style scene
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Tank 7 Farmhouse Ale

review_blob: Aroma is cascadish, floral and earthy notes. appearance is dark black with tan creamy bubbly head. Good legs. Taste is very nice smooth, creamy, choco, citrus, bready, and rich! Palate is clean but full bodied and hint of alco esters. Not too bad for 10% its perfect almost. Overall very good, balanced flavors, aromas and rich sweetness but well crafted. Great offering per style. Loved it. Keep ya warm on a cold night.
beer_name: Clown Shoes Hoppy Feet 1.5 Double Black IPA

review_blob: Not good. Skunky musty funky and pungent. Not worth trying. Please spend your money elsewhere. Just really bad.

Good beer. Was surprised at the hop bill and how well it worked. Crisp fresh and tasty, with hop balls. Almost IPA but nicer and easy going. Pale gold amber. Palate was right on. I liked the brew,
 get some.
Good stuff. Nice balanced malty hoppy taste and palate. A lil burlap and cereal aftertaste. Color is lt brown. Overall pretty good.
ok. It was different but good light wit yeast taste. Appearance is clean goldamber. Has no rye taste which I liked. Palate is clean, not too much hay bread overall, its pretty good.
Awesome. Natural peaches. Not too sweet. Not too hoppy, balanced. Clear gold. Tastes of peach overall. palate is clean. Really well thought out and filtered excellent.

Good stuff. West coast ipa type. Well made and true to style. Something different, but reminiscent of W.C. IPA. Aroma of hop spruce and bread. Looks like amber gold. Taste is piney and crystal malts. Palate is hoppy and bready. Overall is pretty good.

Awesome. Really balanced b/t hop and malt. Stands strong. Musty floral hop, with strong malt spine. good mouthfeel, big beer. Finish is good with hop linger. Looks dark brown amber. Overall its real nice.

I like this beer even though it is a typical mass produced belgin, they still make above and beyond our mass produced brews. Their everyday big beers kick our asses here in USA. Its got a good pale amber reddish color, decent hop, nice mouthfeel, clean finish and overall a really well made belgo brew.
Dont love hefes, but it alright. Not too much yeast funk, clean and decent. The color and palate were within style and not bad, hay, burlap and barn tastes and smell. Overall it was alright.

Really nice. On point with the Blk IPA style. Not too much choco or blk malts. Melded nicely on the tongue. Palate was clean but good feel and taste wasnt too lingering. Aroma was hint of cocoa and hops. Good hop backup, overall pretty good.

I liked it alot. Found it at Breastfest 13. Really nice flavor, blanced and palate had some crispy smoky bacon aftertastes. Looked like a nut brown, so thats right. Overall really nice, different and well done.
Really nice refreshing beer. The hop selection was mild, citrus, grassy but so clean a great touch. Not too much malt to try to compete with the hops, but summer crisp and clean drinking. Very nice!

Pretty good. It was so interesting. Definitely has a belgian wit yeast flavor and feel to it. The IPA part was smothered by the yeast and malt, but had hops to it. Just a really representation of trying new styles, namely saison/IPA but it really came off with a wit flavor.
Really nice. Mild, with a little spice, but very minimal, grassy hops. Overall pretty good beer

Not my favorite, but I had to try it. It is a well crafted beer, just not my favorite style(s) amber/steam beer. Anyway, it looks great, brown amber color with fluffy head.  Aroma is caramel burlap. Taste is Caramelly, malty, hay, bread. Overall good beer for a hybrid style amber, but I didnt love it just because its not my fav. type/style of beer.
beer_name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager

review_blob: Very nice. Well crafted. Aroma is caramel with citrus floral hop nose. Looks copper gold with ok legs. Taste is hop resin up front with spicy earthy aftertaste and lots of full body malts to back it up. Overall its a really nice beer. Its a triple IPA and its brewed true to form .

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Aroma is sparkling grape juice, hay, and dough, citrus. Appearance is pillowy  head, ok legs, and slightly cloudy gold brew. Taste is dough, wheat, citrus spice and hefe yeast. Palate is a lil spice with some hop left. Overall pretty good for  a hefe, but citrus and wit yeast is ok.

Aromas of rose petals, caramel and alcohol, hint of toasted nuts. Appearance is copper/amber colored brew with thin head and semi clear color in the light. Taste is initially sweet from lots of malted barley, but not crazy the first of the taste is sweet brew and 3 seconds later the hops come to the rescue and even out the sip. Leaving a slight layer of spice and earthy hop on the tongue. Overall its not bad, well crafted and balanced but it needs a little something its overall sweet but nice to sip.
beer_name: Karl Strauss Big Barrel Double IPA

review_blob: Aroma us a melange of sweet caramel malt and floral hops, a soft blush wine odor is there. Appearance is amber-gold with thin legs and soft puffy head. Taste is doughy, bready, hints of toasted toffee/caramel with floral and earthy hop resin/spice. There is alot going on. The palate keeps a bit of lupulin and spice on the middle of the tongue after the sip. Overall its really a nice complex beer with great aroma and big rich drinking brew but balanced

great, malty, strong beer. Aroma is strong alco with malty barley and figs. Looks amber red brown with nice foam and good legs. Taste is raisin,dates, figs, malt, and wood. Palate is rich mouthfeel and thin layers of malt. Overall its great, strong rich mouthfeel, smooth creamy and delicious. The almost 10% abv is hidden but its still there.

Not bad, but the Germans are stuck in their ways and they wont change a recipe or create anything interesting or new. So here goes, its a boring German lager type brew. Aroma is burlap and straw. Appearance is clean golden. Taste is hay, straw, cereal and light malt. Palate is horse blanket and clean hay. Overall just average and a rustic barn barley with hints of wheat malt. Ehh

Aroma is white begian/french wit smelling yeast, and hay. Appearance is cloudy/clear yellow golden brew. Taste is muddled but tasty hay, burlap and wet yeasty brew with a wit yeast aftertaste. Palate isnt bad, not saturated and doughy mouthfeel. Overall just so so this is one of the first unibroue beers I didnt really like, but again I am not partial to wit beers typically.

Aroma- esspresso, cocoa nibs, dark chocolate, roast nuts and tofee, alco esters, dried figs and dates, dough. Appearance- is dark coffee black with tan thin head. Taste is chocolate cookie dough, coffee, esspresso, figs, raisins, heavy cereal, tosted oats, earth. Palate- is well balanced, a little warmth, hops come in after the sip but again not too much, easy to drink, Overall Amazing loved it. One of the best beers I ever drank.
beer_name: De Molen / Flying Dog Bat Out Of Hell Oak Aged Version

review_blob: Awesome beer. Strong, rich, complex and did i mention strong. This one has it all. Lots of malt, super balanced in all categories. I am not going to describe this one because there are two kinds of people. The ones who have tried this already and those who have trying to find this one. Get some

Sweet caramel and malt aroma. Appearance is golden amber brew clear with small head and great legs. Taste is full body and mouthfeel, malty, caramel hopped toasted grains, toffee hints, and lots of smooth frothy  resinous brew. Lots of grain and hop but balanced. Great brew, this is a special big beer, and I like it alot, the only thing I would change is go for another floral hop instead of spicy earthy hop. Overall great beer. ?Nice and hearty, when you only want 1 or 2 nice full beers these are up there

Super nice. I loved. aroma is sweet, delicious, resinous hops and malty goodness. Appearance is crystal clear, golden amber, nice head and legs. Taste is sweet, malty brew crisp and the hops slide over the tongue and linger a bit along with some earthy spice. Overall great brew get it while ya can

Really nice beer, very good red. Aroma is soft fig, berry, grape. Appearance is copper amber clear, filtered and good med white head. Taste is sweetish, hoppy rose/grapes fruity flavors mingle then spicy malty grain rushes past and clears the palate and leaves a spiced hop layer on the tongue. Overall really nice, maybe a touch too much spice, but really balanced and awesome.

Pretty good, but the alco esters linger from middle to end of the drink and its a lil much to be a drinkable enjoyable beer, although it is barley wine. Aroma is sweet malty alcoholic grain. Appearance is copper with thin head that falls. Palate is saturated in sweet grain and alcohol. Hops are pretty much unnoticeable. Overall not bad the aftertaste keeps me from loving it

Pretty good. I like the aroma of esspresso and hint of cocoa. Looks pitch black with wispy lil thin tan head. No legs. Taste is roasted coffee beans, caramel, dough, alco esters, earthy hops.  Palate is covered in dark full bodied creamy almost chewy mouthfeel. Overall this brew is real nice, its bold, flavorful, creamy toasty and yummy. Good brew.

Pretty good. Different and dry finish. Earthy notes in the aroma. Taste is clay, bread, leather, spice and malt. Palate is muddled but not bad, not too much hop, mostly subtle hints of dough and spice then dries out. Farmy overall flavor and smell but good and different than alot of christmas beers.

Really nice brew.  Aroma is strong, but in a good way. Soft hops and light sweet fruits and floral aroma. Appearance is nice golden amber with wispy head that falls quickly and legs are thin.  Taste is strong hop resin on tongue that washes back with a good amount of malty grains and bready leather finish. Palate is covered with hops, balanced but forward. Overall really nice. Clean, med body, hopped up and nice. Love it.  IPA is well made

Aroma is soft dough and grapy hop and floral nose. Appearance is great thick head, gold orange color with a lil yeast left, otherwise would have been 5. Taste is slightly tangy at first, then med body maltiness watches over with pale grain flavor, good stuff. Palate is right even with lasting and running, balanced. Overall very nice beer, hopped enough for an IPA lover, although its not hoppy the hop nose and body of the beer carries ibus well, but easy enough for the newbie. NICE~

It was ok. It was def. good for a light beer with more flavor. It has very little anything but is slightly bolder than a regular lt beer. Its clean, clear, crisp, hops are very light, and the strain used is kinda earthy. Overall its decent but good for a lt beer offering, not something I expected from Sam Adams, but ok.
So-so. Not bad not great. Just not my style. Its a light brown with some specialty malts that gave it an off flavor, at least to my tongue it did. Well overall it wasnt bad, just not for me.

Not bad. The aroma wasnt really there but what I got was wet dog and barley. Appearance was ok, brown-copper color with thin head. Taste was good, it had caramel roast and cereal with hops fining out the mix. Palate is malty with a hair of hop on the tongue and a lil spice. Overall pretty good, not what I expected from a christmas style beer, but def a good xmas session beer.
beer_name: Anchor Our Special Ale (2005 and later)
